## Introduction

We live in a fast-paced world where communication plays a vital role. Thanks to technology, people have easy access to different communication tools wherein one of the most commonly used are mobile phones. Alongside these phones are several apps that allow people to connect, talk, and share with each other.

One of these applications is Viber. In this article, we will discuss Viber, its features, advantages, and disadvantages.

## About Viber

Viber is a free messaging and calling app that allows its users to connect with people worldwide. Available on both iOS and Android devices, Viber was launched in 2010 and now has over a billion users from 193 countries. This app is owned by Rakuten Viber, a Japanese e-commerce, and internet company.

## Features

Viber has several features that make it one of the most popular communication apps in the market. Some of these features are:

- Voice and Video Calling: Viber provides free voice and video calls to other Viber users, regardless of the distance.

- Message Broadcast: A feature that allows users to send a message to multiple recipients simultaneously.

- End-to-End Encryption: Viber uses end-to-end encryption on its messages, ensuring that the user's conversation stays private and secure from outside entities.

- Stickers and Emojis: Viber provides a variety of stickers and emojis that users can use in their conversations.

- Group Chats: Users can create and join group chats that allow them to talk and share with multiple people simultaneously.

## Advantages

Viber's popularity is attributed to its advantages compared to other communication applications. Here are some of Viber's advantages:

- Free Messaging and Calls: Viber is free to use and does not charge for sending messages and making calls.

- Large User Base: Viber has a billion users worldwide, which broadens the scope of communication.

- Easy to Use: Viber's user interface is simple and easy to navigate, even for those who are not tech-savvy.

- End-to-End Encryption: Viber's use of end-to-end encryption ensures that private conversations stay secure.

## Disadvantages

Despite its many advantages, Viber also has its disadvantages. Here are some of its downsides:

- Sends Notifications: When Viber is installed on a device, it tends to send numerous notifications, leading to annoyance and disturbance.

- Uses Phone Number: Viber's registration process requires a user's phone number, which can result in privacy concerns.

## Conclusion

In summary, Viber is software that has made communication easier and more convenient. Its features and advantages make it a leading communication app, while its disadvantages are manageable. This app allows users to connect with people worldwide for free, allowing a broader scope of communication.
